Description: Gibson Les Paul Standard 2009 Black After being a featured guitar at the Beverly Hills Gibson Showroom (as denoted on the back of the headstock), this black beauty toured the world for three years with the boy band, Allstar Weekend (Hollywood Records). It has been carefully stored since and we obtained it from the original owner/band member. The guitar has many "beauty marks" (e.g., small dings, scratches, and several paint chips) but looks wonderfully aged with its naturally yellowed binding. Despite its authentically relic'd exterior, the neck is dead straight with low action (currently set up with .09 D'Addario XL strings ) and minimal fret wear. It's a great sounding instrument with classic Les Paul tone and sustain for days with the long neck tenon that this era Les Paul received. It also stays in tune remarkably well. The original case is fully functional and structurally sound, but definitely shows signs of wear from its years on the road. Features: Nitrocellulose finishLong Neck Tenon for superior tone and sustain (largest neck tenon in the history of the Les Paul)Highly regarded asymmetrical neck profile TonePros Locking Tune-o-matic Bridge and Locking Stopbar TailpieceGibson Burstbucker Pro PickupsFactory Plek Set Up FretsLocking Grover TunersDunlop Straplok strap buttonsWeight: 8.6 pounds
Title: Gibson Les Paul Standard 2009
ConditionDescription: Good condition with various nicks and blemishes that do not impact the function of the guitar. All original parts.
